content: French Navy Seizes Pirate ‘Mother Ship’ French forces detained 11 suspected pirates during an assault on what they described as a pirate “mother ship” in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Somalia on Wednesday, less than 24 hours after an American cargo ship was attacked by pirates in the same region. >http://www.nytimes.com/2009/04/16/world/africa/16somalia.html?hp
reply: French Navy Seizes Pirate ‘Mother Ship’ French forces detained 11 suspected pirates during an assault on what they described as a pirate “mother ship” in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Somalia on Wednesday, less than 24 hours after an American cargo ship was attacked by pirates in the same region. >http://www.nytimes.com/2009/04/16/world/africa/16somalia.html?hp
title: French Navy Seizes Pirate ‘Mother Ship’

content: They should have returned the pirates to thier ship, and, in a parting statement ask: "How long can you tread water?" Pull away from the pirates a few hundred yards, then scuttle 'em! What is it going to take, to make these thugs realize that piracy is a no-no?? Unless we all start sinking them, on sight, there will be no real deterent.....
reply: They should have returned the pirates to thier ship, and, in a parting statement ask: "How long can you tread water?" Pull away from the pirates a few hundred yards, then scuttle 'em! What is it going to take, to make these thugs realize that piracy is a no-no?? Unless we all start sinking them, on sight, there will be no real deterent.....

content: It will be interesting to watch and see what it will take to solve this problem.
reply: It will be interesting to watch and see what it will take to solve this problem.
title: French Navy Seizes Pirate ‘Mother Ship’

content: Compliments to the writers and the poster. Much on TV has been snippeats and nothing detailed. I thought I read on another report the American/French connection is soliciting other to make international law so commercial vessels may protect themselves. Arm the crews or post security. You would think this would have been or is common sense approach to piracy. How quick we forget commercial shipping being escorted between the America's and Europe. Thanks again.
reply: Compliments to the writers and the poster. Much on TV has been snippeats and nothing detailed. content: quote: Originally posted by rayevinsonsr: Compliments to the writers and the poster. Much on TV has been snippeats and nothing detailed. I thought I read on another report the American/French connection is soliciting other to make international law so commercial vessels may protect themselves. Arm the crews or post security. You would think this would have been or is common sense approach to piracy. How quick we forget commercial shipping being escorted between the America's and Europe. Thanks again. I gather that the practice of using flags of convenience has lead to countries being sniffy about armed merchantmen. There are standards of crew training and quality that apply to British, US and other first world ships that don't apply to Panamanian vessels who don't care who or what is on teh ship as long as they pay their registration fees.
